Name: Rattata
PkdxEntry: With its incisors, it gnaws through doors and infiltrates people’s homes. Then, with a twitch of its whiskers, it steals whatever food it finds.

Name: Raticate
PkdxEntry: It forms a group of Rattata, which it assumes command of. Each group has its own territory, and disputes over food happen often.

Name: Raichu
PkdxEntry: It only evolves to this form in the Alola region. According to researchers, its diet is one of the causes of this change.

Name: Sandshrew
PkdxEntry: It lives on snowy mountains. Its steel shell is very hard—so much so, it can’t roll its body up into a ball.

Name: Sandslash
PkdxEntry: Fleeing a volcanic eruption, it settled on a snowy mountain. As it races through the snowfields, it sends up a spray of snow.

Name: Vulpix
PkdxEntry: It exhales air colder than -58 degrees Fahrenheit. Elderly people in Alola call this Pokémon by an older name—Keokeo.

Name: Ninetales
PkdxEntry: It creates drops of ice in its coat and showers them over its enemies. Anyone who angers it will be frozen stiff in an instant.

Name: Diglett
PkdxEntry: Its head sports an altered form of whiskers made of metal. When in communication with its comrades, its whiskers wobble to and fro.

Name: Dugtrio
PkdxEntry: Its shining gold hair provides it with protection. It’s reputed that keeping any of its fallen hairs will bring bad luck.

Name: Meowth
PkdxEntry: This Pokémon was not originally found in Alola. Human actions caused a surge in their numbers, and they went feral. They’re prideful and crafty.

Name: Persian
PkdxEntry: Its round face and smooth coat—softer than the most high-class velvet—have made this a very popular Pokémon in Alola.

Name: Geodude
PkdxEntry: Its body is a magnetic stone. Iron sand attaches firmly to the portions of its body that are particularly magnetic.

Name: Graveler
PkdxEntry: Its preferred food is dravite. After it has eaten this mineral, crystals form inside the Pokémon, rising to the surface of part of its body.

Name: Golem
PkdxEntry: It fires rocks charged with electricity. Even if the rock isn’t fired that accurately, just grazing an opponent will cause numbness and fainting.

Name: Grimer
PkdxEntry: A Grimer, which had been brought in to solve a problem with garbage, developed over time into this form.

Name: Muk
PkdxEntry: The garbage it eats causes continuous chemical changes in its body, which produce its exceedingly vivid coloration.

Name: Exeggutor
PkdxEntry: As it grew taller and taller, it outgrew its reliance on psychic powers, while within it awakened the power of the sleeping dragon.

Name: Marowak
PkdxEntry: The bones it possesses were once its mother’s. Its mother’s regrets have become like a vengeful spirit protecting this Pokémon.

Name: Meowth
PkdxEntry: Living with a savage, seafaring people has toughened this Pokémon’s body so much that parts of it have turned to iron.

Name: Ponyta
PkdxEntry: Its small horn hides a healing power. With a few rubs from this Pokémon’s horn, any slight wound you have will be healed.

Name: Rapidash
PkdxEntry: Little can stand up to its psycho cut. Unleashed from this Pokémon’s horn, the move will punch a hole right through a thick metal sheet.

Name: Slowpoke
PkdxEntry: Although this Pokémon is normally zoned out, its expression abruptly sharpens on occasion. The cause for this seems to lie in Slowpoke’s diet.

Name: Slowbro
PkdxEntry: If this Pokémon squeezes the tongue of the Shellder biting it, the Shellder will launch a toxic liquid from the tip of its shell.

Name: Farfetch'd
PkdxEntry: The stalks of leeks are thicker and longer in the Galar region. Farfetch’d that adapted to these stalks took on a unique form.

Name: Weezing
PkdxEntry: This Pokémon consumes particles that contaminate the air. Instead of leaving droppings, it expels clean air.

Name: Mr. Mime
PkdxEntry: Its talent is tap-dancing. It can also manipulate temperatures to create a floor of ice, which this Pokémon can kick up to use as a barrier.

Name: Articuno
PkdxEntry: Its feather-like blades are composed of psychic energy and can shear through thick iron sheets as if they were paper.

Name: Zapdos
PkdxEntry: One kick from its powerful legs will pulverize a dump truck. Supposedly, this Pokémon runs through the mountains at over 180 mph.

Name: Moltres
PkdxEntry: This Pokémon’s sinister, flame-like aura will consume the spirit of any creature it hits. Victims become burned-out shadows of themselves.

Name: Slowking
PkdxEntry: While chanting strange spells, this Pokémon combines its internal toxins with what it’s eaten, creating strange potions.

Name: Corsola
PkdxEntry: Watch your step when wandering areas oceans once covered. What looks like a stone could be this Pokémon, and it will curse you if you kick it.

Name: Zigzagoon
PkdxEntry: Its restlessness has it constantly running around. If it sees another Pokémon, it will purposely run into them in order to start a fight.

Name: Linoone
PkdxEntry: It uses its long tongue to taunt opponents. Once the opposition is enraged, this Pokémon hurls itself at the opponent, tackling them forcefully.

Name: Darumaka
PkdxEntry: It lived in snowy areas for so long that its fire sac cooled off and atrophied. It now has an organ that generates cold instead.

Name: Darmanitan
PkdxEntry: On days when blizzards blow through, it comes down to where people live. It stashes food in the snowball on its head, taking it home for later.

Name: Yamask
PkdxEntry: It’s said that this Pokémon was formed when an ancient clay tablet was drawn to a vengeful spirit.

Name: Stunfisk
PkdxEntry: Its conspicuous lips lure prey in as it lies in wait in the mud. When prey gets close, Stunfisk clamps its jagged steel fins down on them.

Name: Growlithe
PkdxEntry: These Pokémon live in packs in the snowy mountains and defend themselves with icy breath. I suspect this species changed its form to adapt to the frigid climate.

Name: Arcanine
PkdxEntry: Dwells on sacred peaks perpetually covered in snow. Said to appear to virtuous people who have lost their way on mountain paths—it then guides them back down to the mountain’s base.

Name: Voltorb
PkdxEntry: An enigmatic Pokémon that happens to bear a resemblance to a Poké Ball. When excited, it discharges the electric current it has stored in its belly, then lets out a great, uproarious laugh.

Name: Electrode
PkdxEntry: The tissue on the surface of its body is curiously similar in composition to an Apricorn. When irritated, this Pokémon lets loose an electric current equal to 20 lightning bolts.

Name: Typhlosion
PkdxEntry: Said to purify lost, forsaken souls with its flames and guide them to the afterlife. I believe its form has been influenced by the energy of the sacred mountain towering at Hisui’s center.

Name: Qwilfish
PkdxEntry: Fishers detest this troublesome Pokémon because it sprays poison from its spines, getting it everywhere. A different form of Qwilfish lives in other regions.

Name: Sneasel
PkdxEntry: Its sturdy, curved claws are ideal for traversing precipitous cliffs. From the tips of these claws drips a venom that infiltrates the nerves of any prey caught in Sneasel’s grasp.

Name: Samurott
PkdxEntry: Hard of heart and deft of blade, this rare form of Samurott is a product of the Pokémon’s evolution in the region of Hisui. Its turbulent blows crash into foes like ceaseless pounding waves.

Name: Lilligant
PkdxEntry: I suspect that its well-developed legs are the result of a life spent on mountains covered in deep snow. The scent it exudes from its flower crown heartens those in proximity.

Name: Zorua
PkdxEntry: A once-departed soul, returned to life in Hisui. Derives power from resentment, which rises as energy atop its head and takes on the forms of foes. In this way, Zorua vents lingering malice.

Name: Zoroark
PkdxEntry: With its disheveled white fur, it looks like an embodiment of death. Heedless of its own safety, Zoroark attacks its nemeses with a bitter energy so intense, it lacerates Zoroark’s own body.

Name: Braviary
PkdxEntry: Screaming a bloodcurdling battle cry, this huge and ferocious bird Pokémon goes out on the hunt. It blasts lakes with shock waves, then scoops up any prey that float to the water’s surface.

Name: Sliggoo
PkdxEntry: A creature given to melancholy. I suspect its metallic shell developed as a result of the mucus on its skin reacting with the iron in Hisui’s water.

Name: Goodra
PkdxEntry: Able to freely control the hardness of its metallic shell. It loathes solitude and is extremely clingy—it will fume and run riot if those dearest to it ever leave its side.

Name: Avalugg
PkdxEntry: The armor of ice covering its lower jaw puts steel to shame and can shatter rocks with ease. This Pokémon barrels along steep mountain paths, cleaving through the deep snow.

_id.Name: Decidueye
_id.PkdxEntry: The air stored inside the rachises of Decidueye’s feathers insulates the Pokémon against Hisui’s extreme cold. This is firm proof that evolution can be influenced by environment.

Name: Decidueye
PkdxEntry: The air stored inside the rachises of Decidueye’s feathers insulates the Pokémon against Hisui’s extreme cold. This is firm proof that evolution can be influenced by environment.
